bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of heat congestion in the heart and lung brought about by wind heat evil [qi], or excessive consumption of “hot” medication, or excessive consumption of alcoholic beverages. Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 21: 夫熱毒風者，皆由臟腑風虛，外邪所中， 心肺壅熱，風氣在於胸心，或因吃熱藥，或飲酒過度，即頭面腫熱，心 神煩悶，眼目昏昏，或時語澀，痰粘壅滯，皮膚壯熱，面赤口乾，肢節 不利者，是其候也 , “Now, as for heat poison wind , all such conditions result from wind depletion of depots and palaces struck by external evil. The heart and lung are obstructed with heat, and the wind qi is in the chest and heart. The reason may be consumption of hot medication, or excessive drinking of alcoholic beverages. As a result, the head and face are swollen and hot. The heart and spirit experience vexation with heart-pressure. Vision is dimmed. In some cases language is impaired, and sticky phlegm forms obstructions. The skin is very hot. The face is red and the mouth is dry. Limbs and joints do not move freely. These are its signs”.
